application.ref: GROBID - A machine learning software for extracting information from scholarly documents

titleStmt.title: System Identification of Partial Differential Equations

analytic.title: System Identification of Partial Differential Equations

div.head: 2D Euler Equations:
div.p: To add noise at a level 2, add AGWN at each point Every PDE can be represented as a linear combination of nonlinear features:
The candidate features are constructed using a domain specific grammar. Expressions are sampled with a preference for concise statements
div.formula: Feature Search Algorithm ℝ ↦ ⁄ !ℝ !' 8 ℝ ↦ ℝ×ℝ ℝ ↦ ℝ/ℝ ℝ ↦ |ℝ| ℝ ↦ " 8 | ;
Sample Expression: " × ⁄ !" !' " × " ⁄ ! !' θ for ' 8 in cols(E): compute F GHI & from [ K E, ' 8 ] and M append best ' 8 to K E M Grammar E Feature Expander F GHI & improves? K E MLR No Yes
div.p: The system successfully identifies the model processes with sufficient data. The system is robust to noise for the 1D process while the 2D process performed worse. Both processes were identified in the low-data limit with only moderate parameter error.
• Improve feature search algorithm to include stochasticity through genetic algorithms • Check robustness to different types of noise • Apply to real world data of fluid flows
